Title: Permits the use of cremation or natural organic reduction as the method of disposition for certain decedents
Summary: Permits a chief fiscal officer of a county or a public administrator, when having the right to control the disposition of the remains of a decedent and acting reasonably and in good faith, to, without civil liability, select cremation or natural organic reduction as the method of disposition for such decedent where the financial resources of such decedent are limited and such disposition is selected with the reasonable belief that the method is consistent with the religious practices of the decedent.

ActClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to permitting the use of cremation or natural organic reduction as the method of disposition for certain decedents
